alert.note: Alert for Erie; Huron; Sandusky; Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 03 at 7:02PM EDT until May 03 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio and northwest Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Erie and Huron. In northwest Ohio, Sandusky and Seneca. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 702 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sandusky, Tiffin, Bellevue, Clyde, Green Springs, Castalia, Bay View, Republic, Flat Rock, Vickery, Whites Landing, Bloomingville, Sandusky South and Fairview Lanes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
